headline: Double-digit healthcare cost increases projected to persist into 2026 and beyond
summary: NEW YORK, Nov. 11, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Global health insurance costs are projected to rise by over 10% again next year, as healthcare inflation continues to rise following steep cost increases in recent years, according to WTW’s 2026 Global Medical Trends report. The survey of health insurers found that the average cost of medical health benefits will increase by 10.3% globally next year. This follows rises of 10% in 2025 and 9.5% in 2024. Regionally, the highest cost increases are expected

headline: A Look at Willis Towers Watson’s Valuation After Its Earnings Turnaround and Return to Profitability
summary: Willis Towers Watson (WTW) recently turned heads with its latest quarterly earnings, showing a swing back to profitability and positive earnings per share after recording steep losses a year ago. This shift in performance has drawn renewed interest among investors. See our latest analysis for Willis Towers Watson. Momentum around Willis Towers Watson has been mixed in recent months, despite its shift back to profitability. While the company’s ongoing share buyback program and new leadership...
